questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation:
- we have partnered with OperationWebTree, which uses Silvi protocol on Celo to help us track our urban reforestation campaign 
- we have talked about and introduced Celo in our onboarding workshops that focus on regenerative crypto

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoinâ€™s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: We have updated our application to include these, but since our last grant round we purchased and planted 160 white pines across Ottawa, ran an onboarding workshop with 30+ attendees and helped bring them onchain by setting up wallets and giving them .0015 eth to explore and mint things. We also helped co-host Ottawa Bitcoin Pizza Day. We issued onchain proof of attendance badges to attendees of all our workshops - https://opensea.io/collection/greenpill-ottawa-event-attendee . We ran an into to ReFi workshop and We also have helped incubate RootedLABs which set up a distributed compute system that recycles heat into greenhouses

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation: Yes we participated in the Octant x GreenPill round, and our chapter steward Lana, was the round operator for this round. https://reportcards.gitcoin.co/10/0xe9459565709c5e856ffbc3cc8715824945d92de7

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Octant has been a community we bring up at workshops to help showcase how the ecosystem as a whole is focused on funding public goods. Our chapter steward and members have also supported in running Octant contests on Farcaster.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We focus on education and onboarding in general and have helped bring people into the Octant ecosystem and will continue to do so. This includes showing people how Octant works, how to stake their GLM and more.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Ottawa GreenPill and its community members would love to continue to support and run campaigns with Octant. 

This can include education and bringing qualified folks into the Octant ecosystem via GLM, staking and ensuring folks vote in the epoch rounds. 

We also will continue to support and encourage projects to apply to Octant rounds, and would love to even run a round with Octant again. 

We will also highlight Octant in our next workshop, and use some of our funds to help onboard folks. (we used funds from the Octant x GP round to distribute eth to folks being onboarded at our last workshop)

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation:
Our chapter steward Lana and contributor Kate, are dedicated Octant community members already who are actively running Octant growth campaigns on Farcaster. 

Other Ottawa community member Tay and co-organizer of Bitcoin Pizza Day,  is a longterm Pizza DAO member who has helped onboard and bring more people into the Octant Community.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: We're on the same team, trying to support public goods and have a tangible impact.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation: We are team players who often partner with other communities to run events, give talks, host spaces etc.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: We will use it to continue to onboard people, host workshops, donate to local causes/charities and support our contributor's efforts.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation:
https://mirror.xyz/kateg.eth/06OJF_GWVbmJfKAv2oQVFcaWlRHYfXuuKEIhS4baUQE

Kate is a contributor/member of GP Ottawa

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
We have already purchased 500 white pine saplings and will work with 15+ community partners to plant them throughout the Ottawa-Gatineau region.

 We will be using Silvi Protocol on Celo and will, therefore, help onboard new users, show them how to set up their wallets, and start tracking their tree planting/tree maturation growth. We'll also host workshops and tutorials for our community partners. 

We are also going to commit a portion of the USDGLO received from this round to planting commitment pools on Silvi. The goal is to use these funds to reward the white pine tree planters to update their progress and continue to use their wallets and Silvi as an app. 

We are co-hosting and sponsoring Ottawa Bitcoin Pizza Day for the 3rd year in a row.

We are continuing to work with Regeneration Canada to help bring aspects of their work on-chain and help them find ways to integrate blockchain/crypto.  

We are a part of the GreenPill Genesis staking squad and will work with other Ottawa community members to set up and be a part of the GPN staking squad. 

One of our goals this year is to use a portion of our treasury in DeFi lending pools to then use the yield earned to donate to local charities and organizations. Our goal at the end of the year is to write a recap report on how the community can use DeFi to fund their causes without touching their principal.
